Katharine Willa Sipio

Writing.
I'm a word nerd and an aspiring author.


Below you will find my two main blogs, which focus on the study of digital aesthetics and project descriptions, as well as my curious exploration of nature. I also write poetry and songs in my eclectic collection of coffee and tea stained journals. As an undergraduate, I made it my mission to etch out my favorite place in the library and to actively participate in a number of creative writing workshops. They primarily focused on animals in literature, nature writing, and fiction. My Honors Departmental Thesis will be a Young Adult fiction novella that chronicles how the main protagonist's experiences with nature affect her perspectives and reflections on things. However, it is my hope to also create a digital story that uses transmedia storytelling techniques to make it more interactive, engaging, and immersive for readers. The story will contain many explorative qualities and research of nature elements that are present in the northeast of the U.S. for the setting of the book. Below you will also find a sampling of my personal favorite and more extensive writing projects from over my fours years of study in the English Department at St. Joseph's University.
